manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Camel Case Movement and Selection
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module provides Camel Case Movement and Selection. It supports toggling of case of first char of an idetifier. It also supports several forms of parameter, variable, array parameter and array variable declarations.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.editor.lib/1 > 1.3, org.openide.nodes > 6.6.1, org.openide.text > 6.9, org.openide.util > 6.5.1, org.openide.windows > 6.4.1

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Interactively work with Code Templates. Support for Registers.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Interactively work with Code Templates. Support for Registers. To insert a Code Template: 1. Invoke "Show Templates ..." action. 2. Select a template from the list. 3. Preview it. 4. Click on Insert to insert the selected Code Template. If the text editor has any selection that wll be inserted at the cursor location resulting after Code Template insertion.. 4. Click Modify... to modify selected template. 5. Click Delete... to delete selected template. To create a Code Template: 1. Select text in editor. 2. Invoke "Create Template..." action. 3. Name the template and insert any parameters using the ${<parameter-name>} syntax. Additional supported parameters: ${selection editable=false} - replaced by the Selection when the code template is inserted. ${clipboard-content editable=false} replaced by the text in clipboard when the code template is inserted. 4. Click on Save to save the Code Template. Cut, Copy and Paste to Registers from 0-9 and A-Z. Xtrl+J R X - Cut to register Xtrl+J R C - Copy to register Xtrl+J R V - Paste from register. Paste is implemented as a template insert so that the magic of parameter substitution can happen. This is implemented using Code Templates named "REG_" + Register name. The "REG_" prefix can be overridden using the System property "org.netbeans.modules.codetemplatetools.REGISTER_PREFIX". It must be string with alphanumerics and _.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.editor/3, org.netbeans.modules.editor.codetemplates/1 > 1.1.1, org.openide.dialogs > 6.5.1, org.openide.nodes > 6.6.1, org.openide.options, org.openide.text > 6.8.1, org.openide.util, org.openide.windows > 6.4.1

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Move Line Up, Move Line Down, Copy Line Up, Copy Line Down actions in text editors.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Support following operations in text editors: 1. Move Line (or lines spanned by selection) Up 2. Move Line (or lines spanned by selection) Down 3. Copy Line (or lines spanned by selection) Up 4. Copy Line (or lines spanned by selection) Down 5. Sort lines spanned by selection in ascending order 6. Sort lines spanned by selection in descending order 7. Remove duplicate lines while sorting. Maintain the caret position, the selection and the order of start and end of the selection when moving/copying the lines.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Simplifies internationalization of applications.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Internationalization module, combined with the Properties module, simplifies internationalization of Java applications. It includes a wizard, which enables you to internationalize all of your Java at once, a test tool, which reports any missing key-value pairs, and an execution service, which enables you to set the locale in which the application is to run.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Resource Bundles module provides support for browsing .properties files in the Explorer and editing them in the Source Editor or in a table view.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Module that improves integration between refactoring commands and version control commands.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The VCS Refactoring Bridge module improves integration between refactoring and version control commands. The module identifies any files affected by refactoring commands that need to be checked out and made editable in your version control system.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables you to integrate any version control system that has a command-line interface.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The VCS Generic Support module enables you to integrate any version control system for which there is a command-line interface (such as CVS, RCS, or SCCS) into the IDE. Support for individual version control systems can be added as profiles. Additional profiles can be downloaded from http://vcsgeneric.netbeans.org/profiles/index.html. Note that installing this module disables the built-in NetBeans 5.0 CVS support.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Bridge module between Java and VCS modules.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The VCS Java Bridge module provides a connection between Java and VCS modules that ensures that the parser database is up-to-date after VCS operations.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.openide.filesystems > 6.2, org.openide.util > 6.2, org.openide.modules > 6.2, org.netbeans.modules.vcscore/1 > 1.13, org.netbeans.modules.javacore/1 > 1.5, org.netbeans.modules.jmiutils/1

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Provides basis for integration of version control systems.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The VCS Core module provides the basic structure and libraries on which modules for various version control systems can be based.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.openide.filesystems > 6.2, org.openide.util > 6.2, org.openide.modules > 6.2, org.openide.nodes > 6.2, org.openide.explorer > 6.2, org.openide.awt > 6.2, org.openide.dialogs > 6.2, org.openide.compat > 6.2, org.openide.options > 6.2, org.openide.windows > 6.2, org.openide.text > 6.2, org.openide.actions > 6.2, org.openide.execution > 1.2, org.openide.io > 1.0, org.openide.loaders > 4.11, org.openidex.util/2-3, org.netbeans.modules.masterfs/1 > 1.1, org.netbeans.modules.queries/1 > 1.4

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Provides XTest testing infrastructure samples.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module provides XTest testing infrastructure samples on Anagrams sample J2SE project.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.jemmy.idemodule/2, org.netbeans.modules.project.ant/1, org.netbeans.modules.projectuiapi/1, org.netbeans.modules.xtest/1 > 1.5.40, org.openide.dialogs > 6.2, org.openide.filesystems > 6.2, org.openide.loaders, org.openide.modules > 6.2, org.openide.nodes > 6.2, org.openide.options > 6.2, org.openide.util > 6.2
